title: MANPATH not properly handled by environments/modules

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
Loading an environment/module breaks the `man` command. `MANPATH` is used to give a list of directories to search for man pages. The default (no path) searches typical system locations. As soon as you populate `MANPATH` (e.g. `/home/adam/foo/.spack-env/view/share/man:/home/adam/foo/.spack-env/view/man`), it no longer searches system locations. You need to add a trailing colon to `MANPATH` to get it to search system locations.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

The issue affects environments:
```console
$ spack env activate foo
$ man bash
No manual entry for bash
```
It also affects modules and the load command:
```console
$ spack load zlib
$ man bash
No manual entry for bash
```

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.14.2-1395-4c976dfe6
* **Python:** 3.7.7
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu20.04-skylake (via WSL)

### Known Workarounds

For now, I can do this to solve the issue:
```console
$ export MANPATH+=:
```
In the long run, Spack should be smart enough to always add a trailing colon to `MANPATH`, even if we have to make a special case for it.

### Additional information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

This is the best summary of the problem I've found so far: https://github.com/fish-shell/fish-shell/issues/2090

@alalazo
